# Hands-on Exercise 1 Geospatial Data Science with R

## 1 Overview

Geospatial Data Science is a process of importing, wrangling, integrating, and processing geographically referenced data sets. In this hands-on exercise, we will learn how to perform geospatial data science tasks in R using the sf package.

## 1.2 Data Acquisition

Data are key to data analytics including geospatial analytics. Hence, before analysing, we need to assemble the necessary data. In this hands-on exercise, we are required to extract the necessary data sets from the following sources:

1.Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary (Web) from data.gov.sg

2.Pre-Schools Location from data.gov.sg

3.Cycling Path from LTADataMall

## 1.3 Getting Started



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf,tidyverse)
```
:::



## 1.4 Importing Geospatial Data

### 1.4.1 Importing polygon feature data in shapefile format



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `/Users/yangyayong/Downloads/学校文件/smu文件/Term 3/G/yyyirene/ISSS626-GAA/Hands-on_Ex/Hands-on_Ex01/data/geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::



### 1.4.2 Importing polyline feature data in shapefile form



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cyclingpath = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                         layer = "CyclingPathGazette")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `CyclingPathGazette' from data source 
  `/Users/yangyayong/Downloads/学校文件/smu文件/Term 3/G/yyyirene/ISSS626-GAA/Hands-on_Ex/Hands-on_Ex01/data/geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 3138 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTILINESTRING
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 11854.32 ymin: 28347.98 xmax: 42644.17 ymax: 48948.15
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::



### 1.4.3 Importing GIS data in kml format



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool = st_read("data/geospatial/PreSchoolsLocation.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `PRESCHOOLS_LOCATION' from data source 
  `/Users/yangyayong/Downloads/学校文件/smu文件/Term 3/G/yyyirene/ISSS626-GAA/Hands-on_Ex/Hands-on_Ex01/data/geospatial/PreSchoolsLocation.kml' 
  using driver `KML'

Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6878 ymin: 1.247759 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

## 1.6 Plotting the Geospatial Data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot
all
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(mpsz))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz["PLN_AREA_N"])
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## 1.7 Working with Projection

### 1.7.1 Assigning EPSG code to a simple feature data frame



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: SVY21 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21[WGS84]",
        DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
            ID["EPSG",6326]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]],
    CONVERSION["unnamed",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["(E)",east,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]],
        AXIS["(N)",north,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]]]
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414 <- st_transform(mpsz, 3414)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414

```


:::
:::



### 1.7.2 Transforming the projection of preschool from wgs84 to svy21.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool3414 <- st_transform(preschool, 
                              crs = 3414)
```
:::



## 1.8 Importing and Converting An Aspatial Data

### 1.8.1 Importing the aspatial data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings <- read_csv("data/aspatial/listings.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 3540 Columns: 75
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","

dbl  (38): id, scrape_id, host_id, host_listings_count, host_total_listings_...
lgl   (6): host_is_superhost, host_has_profile_pic, host_identity_verified, ...
date  (5): last_scraped, host_since, calendar_last_scraped, first_review, la...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
list(listings) 
```

### 1.8.2 Creating a simple feature data frame from an aspatial data frame



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings_sf <- st_as_sf(listings, 
                       coords = c("longitude", "latitude"),
                       crs=4326) %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glimpse(listings_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

:::

## 1.9 Geoprocessing with sf package

### 1.9.1 Buffering



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
buffer_cycling <- st_buffer(cyclingpath, 
                               dist=5, nQuadSegs = 30)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
buffer_cycling$AREA <- st_area(buffer_cycling)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sum(buffer_cycling$AREA)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
2218855 [m^2]
```


:::
:::



### 1.9.2 Point-in-polygon count



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`<- lengths(st_intersects(mpsz3414, preschool3414))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   0.00    0.00    4.00    7.09   10.00   72.00 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
top_n(mpsz3414, 1, `PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 16 fields

Dimension:     XY
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$Area <- mpsz3414 %>%
  st_area()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414 <- mpsz3414 %>%
  mutate(`PreSch Density` = `PreSch Count`/Area * 1000000)
```
:::



## 1.10 Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mpsz3414$`PreSch Density`)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  labs(title = "Are pre-school even distributed in Singapore?",
       subtitle= "There are many planning sub-zones with a single pre-school, on the other hand, \nthere are two planning sub-zones with at least 20 pre-schools",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Frequency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(y = `PreSch Count`, 
           x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_point(color="black", 
             fill="light blue") +
  xlim(0, 40) +
  ylim(0, 40) +
  labs(title = "",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Pre-school count")
```
